intro: Seseli peixoteanum, commonly known as the Peixotean Seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant features a tall, slender stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of silky hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, producing a delicate, white or pale green color. Seseli peixoteanum is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine environments.
